thread.title: UH stomps Tulane to remain perfect
thread.title_full: UH stomps Tulane to remain perfect

author: Joseph Duarte
title: UH stomps Tulane to remain perfect
text:
UH stomps Tulane to remain perfect By Joseph Duarte Published 11:23 pm, Friday, October 16, 2015 Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 1 of / 11 Close Image 1 of 11 Houston wide receiver Demarcus Ayers (10) dodges Tulane defenders during the first quarter of the NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Houston wide receiver Demarcus Ayers (10) dodges Tulane defenders during the first quarter of the NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 2 of 11 Tulane quarterback Devin Powell (1) looks for a open receiver during the first half of an NCAA college football game against Houston in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Tulane quarterback Devin Powell (1) looks for a open receiver during the first half of an NCAA college football game against Houston in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 3 of 11 Houston quarterback Greg Ward Jr., right, runs out of the pocket under pressure from Tulane defensive tackle Corey Redwine (96) in the first quarter of an NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Houston quarterback Greg Ward Jr., right, runs out of the pocket under pressure from Tulane defensive tackle Corey Redwine (96) in the first quarter of an NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, ... more Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 4 of 11 Houston quarterback Greg Ward Jr. (1) throws during warmups before an NCAA college football game against Tulane in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Houston quarterback Greg Ward Jr. (1) throws during warmups before an NCAA college football game against Tulane in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 5 of 11 Houston quarterback Greg Ward Jr. (1) runs into the end zone to score against Tulane during an NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Houston quarterback Greg Ward Jr. (1) runs into the end zone to score against Tulane during an NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 6 of 11 Houston safety Trevon Stewart (23) attempts to tackle Tulane running back Dontrell Hilliard, center, in the first quarter of an NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Houston safety Trevon Stewart (23) attempts to tackle Tulane running back Dontrell Hilliard, center, in the first quarter of an NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max ... more Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 7 of 11 Tulane running back Dontrell Hilliard (26) is tackled by Houston linebacker Elandon Roberts, left, and cornerback Brandon Wilson, upper right, during an NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Tulane running back Dontrell Hilliard (26) is tackled by Houston linebacker Elandon Roberts, left, and cornerback Brandon Wilson, upper right, during an NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, ... more Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 8 of 11 Sweat sprays off of Tulane quarterback Devin Powell (1) ad he takes a hit just after making a pass during the first half of an NCAA college football game against Houston in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Sweat sprays off of Tulane quarterback Devin Powell (1) ad he takes a hit just after making a pass during the first half of an NCAA college football game against Houston in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, ... more Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 9 of 11 Houston quarterback Kyle Postma (3) warms up before an NCAA college football game against Tulane in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Houston quarterback Kyle Postma (3) warms up before an NCAA college football game against Tulane in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 10 of 11 Tulane wide receiver Devon Breaux (8) completes a pass against Houston during the first half of an NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Tulane wide receiver Devon Breaux (8) completes a pass against Houston during the first half of an NCAA college football game in New Orleans, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Max Becherer) Photo: Max Becherer, Associated Press Image 11 of 11 UH stomps Tulane to remain perfect 1 / 11 
NEW ORLEANS – At times, the well-oiled offensive machine sputtered. 
Turns out it was just a few potholes along the way. 
Greg Ward Jr. continued his dominating first half of the season with three rushing touchdowns, and Demarcus Ayers had a 63-yard punt return for another score as the No. 24 Cougars rolled to a 42-7 win over Tulane on Friday night at Yulman Stadium. 
Ward had touchdown runs of 12, 5 and 2 yards to push his nation-leading total to 14, one shy of the school record set by Jackie Battle in 2006. 
Ayers added a 15-yard touchdown off a reverse and had another punt return called back by a holding penalty. 
No matter. The Cougars – ranked for the first time in four years - did all it needed early en route to the fifth 6-0 start in school history. 
The win extends UH's winning streak to eight games dating back to last season. It was also the Cougars' fourth straight win by double-digits. 
Tulane managed only a second-quarter touchdown – aided by a fake punt – and had only 262 yards total offense against a stingy UH defense. Both were season low totals for the Cougars. 
The Green Wave, without starting quarterback Tanner Lee (concussion), had 11 punts in the game in losing for the 39th straight time against a ranked opponent. 
Ward finished 17-of-25 for 222 yards with one touchdown and added 77 rushing yards and three more scores. Ayers had six catches for 93 yards.
